Homicide by Intox Use of Vehicle (2nd+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M Gillett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
DOC COLLECT
-----------------------------------

Maintain full time employment or school or combination of both unless determined by Agent or a doctor that full time is not feasible.
-----------------------------------

No alcohol.  No controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.   No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. No prescription medications without a valid prescription and then only in prescribed amounts. Not to operate motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. 
-----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
-----------------------------------
  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------------

supervisions.notes:
Pay $350.00 fine plus costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
-----------------------------------

WITHOUT Huber privileges; CONCURRENT to count #1
Concurrent with: Count #1
Comply with A & R - Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan

02:00 PM Defendant Aaron M Gillett in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski.  Diane M. Donohoo and Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:02 pm  State is in compliance with victim's rights.  Court has reviewed victim impact statements.  There is no restitution request.
2:04 pm  Rebecca Baertschi addresses the Court on behalf of defendant.
2:09 pm  Deanna Gillett addresses the Court on behalf of defendant.
2:13 pm  Norman Eckstaedt on behalf of the victim's family.
2:24 pm  Court has reviewed the victim impact statements.
2:24 pm  Sentencing argument and recommendation by ADA Donohoo.
2:29 pm  Attorney Melowski addresses the victim's family.
2:31 pm  Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Melowski.
2:34 pm  Defendant addresses the victim's family and extends an apology.
2:35 pm  Court addresses both sides.
2:37 pm  Court has considered three primary sentencing factors.
2:47 pm  Court imposes the following sentence:

Count 1 - Ten (10) years in the Wisconsin State Prison System, bifurcated as five (5) years Initial Confinement followed by five (5) years Extended Supervision
Defendant is NOT eligible for CIP or SAP.
No dead time credit.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Costs, including supervision fees
Undergo any evaluations and follow-through with any treatment recommended by Agent
Counseling as recommended by Agent
No contact with victim or victim's family withouto victim's and Agent's consent
No alcohol
No controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No prescriptions medications without a valid prescription and then only in prescribed amounts
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid DL
Maintain full-time employment or school or combination of both unless determined by Agent or a doctor that full-time is not feasible
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge


Count 2 - Six (6) months Jail WITHOUT Huber, concurrent to Count 1
Pay $350 fine plus costs
Eighteen (18) month revocation of DL and IID
A&R
Provide DNA sample and surcharge
*per KED email 18 month of IID

**TRANSCRIPT FIED 4-6-2020: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**

Defendant Aaron M Gillett in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski.  Special Prosecutor Diane Donohoo & attorney Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is assigned to Judge Drettwan, parties do not object to Judge Koss taking the plea as this matter is not specifically assigned. Atty Melowski makes record as to the plea agreement. Deft would not be eligible for programming. Victims are present & are not requesting a restitution claim. Deft acknowledges he is giving up his right to appeal as part of this agreement. Deft is waiving his right to direct appeal as to motion to suppress blood draw. Atty Melowski makes record on this. Deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 2, no PSI ordered. Minutes filed.

01:03 PM  Special Prosecutor Diane M. Donohoo appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dennis Michael Melowski appeared by phone means for Defendant Aaron M Gillett.
1:04 pm  Attorney Melowski waives defendant's appearance.
Court addresses scheduling of jury trial and final pretrial and sets scheduling deadlines.
Attorney Melowski will have thirty days to file motion with an offer of proof regarding medical marijuana defense due no later than June 7, 2019.
State to file their response by July 5, 2019.
Court will set for oral ruling on July 23, 2019 at 2:30 pm.
Defense to file their expert witness list with curriculum vitaes and/or summaries by July 1, 2019.  State to file their list by July 24, 2019.
State must file any Daubert challenges by July 24, 2019.
All discovery, including disclosure of witnesses must be made sixty days prior to trial or no later than November 8, 2019.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2020 at 11:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on May 6, 2019 at 01:00 pm.

10:02 AM Defendant Aaron M Gillett in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski.  Special Prosecutor Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:04 am  Request by defense for a Daubert hearing pursuant to 907.02.
10:05 am  Court will not hold an evidentiary hearing or Daubert hearing as to the reliability of testing methods used by the Wisconsin State Lab of Hygiene.
10:07 am  Court takes judicial notice of admissibility and underlying reliability of methods used under Daubert and 907.02.
10:09 am  Limits of detection and margins for error with regard for testing for DFE will be addressed today.
10:10 am  Court hears first from Attorney Melowski.
10:13 am  Court turns to Attorney Donohoo.  Attorney Donohoo advises Court that analyst Lorrine Edwards is available to testify by phone.
10:16 am  Response by Attorney Melowski who argues lab has not been able to quantify amount of DFE.
10:19 am  Court will not take testimony.
10:19 am  Court has not heard anything today to change position.
10:22 am  Court finds reasoning and admissibility of evidence is scientifically valid. 
10:23 am  For all the reasons stated on the record, Court will not grant this motion.  Attorney Melowski will submit an order.
10:27 am  Set over for scheduling conference.  Both attorneys can appear by  phone.  Court will be set trial dates and motion deadlines.
10:28 am  Court in recess.
  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2019 at 01:00 pm.
IT IS ORDERD that the petition for leave to appeal is denied without costs.
Oath and Consent to Serve as Special Prosecutor

1:32 pm  Defendant Aaron M Gillett in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:32 pm  Court has limited scope of today's hearing due to time constraints.
1:32 pm  Attorney Melowski moves for sequestration of witnesses.  ADA Donohoo designates Officer Stefanczyk as her court officer making motion moot.
1:33 pm  Officer Anthony Ambach, Town of Delavan PD, duly sworn and testified on direct exam of ADA Donohoo.
1:41 pm  Record reflects accurate identification of defendant by witness.
1:47 pm  Cross by Attorney Melowski.
2:01 pm  Redirect by ADA Donohoo.
2:05 pm  Recross by Attorney Melowski.
2:07 pm  Lieutenant Scot Stefanczyk, Town of Delavan PD, duly sworn and testified on direct exam of ADA Donohoo.
2:09 pm  Record reflects accurate identification of defendant by witness.
2:19 pm  Exh 1 marked and identified.
2:20 pm  Exh 1 offered by ADA Donohoo and received without objection from defense.
2:28 pm  Cross by Attorney Melowski.
2:22 pm  Exh 2 marked and identified.
2:35 pm  Exh 2 offered and received in its entirety.
2:57 pm  Redirect by ADA Donohoo.
3:08 pm  Recress by Attorney Melowski.
3:11 pm  Court has reviewed briefs and will entertain argument.
3:12 pm  Argument by ADA Donohoo.
3:13 pm  Argument by Attorney Melowski.
3:25 pm  Attorney Melowski argues that Blackman is directly on point.
3:26 pm  Follow-up by ADA Donohoo.
3:29 pm  Court is ready to make ruling.
3:41 pm  Court finds Lieutenant Stefanczyk's testimony to be credible.
3:49 pm  Court finds defendant voluntarily consented to a blood draw prior to Informing the Accused being read.
3:50 pm  Court has read Blackman.
3:52 pm  Court finds holding from Blackman does not apply to this case and the facts of this case are distinguishable.
3:55 pm  Court finds Lieutenant Stefanczyk acted in good faith.
3:59 pm  Court will apply good faith exception.
3:59 pm  For all the reasons stated on the record, Court denies motion.
4 pm  Limited Daubert motion remains to be addressed.
4:01 pm  Attorney Melowski believes an interlocutory appeal will be filed and requests a status be set about 60 days out.  Status conference scheduled for December 4, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Order granting petition for leave to appeal

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the petition for leave to appeal is granted, without costs.  The entry of this order has the effect of the filing of a notice of appeal.  A copy of this order has been forwarded to the clerk fo the circuit court.  Pursuant to RULE 809.11(2), the clerk fo the cirucit court or responsible court official shall return the copy of the order graning this petition and the docket entries maintained pursuant to WIS. STAT. 59.40, to the clerk of this court within three days of receipt of the order.
Substitution of Attorneys

1:59 pm  Attorney James B. Duquette appeared.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing added to expand record on denial of request for new counsel and delay of trial.
Attorney Duquette has nothing to add to arguments previously made.
Court's ruling was based on various reasons which were stated on the record.
Request for continuance was denied and motion to withdraw appeared to be last ditch effort.
Court was concerned motion was for purposes of delay and was dilatory.
Court considered living victim's wishes in denying continuance.  State had 4-10 witnesses ready to proceed.
There is no record of breakdown in communication.  Motion to withdraw was denied as there was no other counsel that has stepped up ready to take case.
2:06 pm  ADA Donohoo makes a record that based on conversations made at a conference, it has come to her attention that Attorney Melowski was approached by the defendant's family and was willing to potentially take on this case.
ADA Donohoo further notes that the stress of trial delay has caused victim to seek medical attention.
ADA Donohoo advised Court there is now a third case from Dodge County at the Court of Appeals.
2:10 pm  Attorney Duquette advises Court that he has spoken with Attorney Melowski but at this point he is still the attorney of record.
Court makes record clear that he is aware that defendant's right to due process trumps other rights, including the victim's, but believes there was no due process violation.
Court in recess.
Minutes filed.
Acknowledgement of filing of Writ/ Peitition (Petition for Leave to Appeal)

IT IS ORDERED that the motion for a stay is granted and circuit court proceedings are stayed pending disposition of the petition for leave to appeal.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that in accordance with WIS. STAT. RULE 809.50(2), the respondent shall file a response to the petition with a supporting memorandum within fourteen days of the service of the petition.
State's
Exhibits stored in file

CLERK:  Laurie Brown
2:04 pm  Defendant Aaron M Gillett in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Donohoo objects to omissions in proposed order from yesterday's hearing.  Court has not seen order.
Attorney Duquette provides Court with proposed order.
Court reviews proposed order and finds there are omissions as to record made.
Argument by Attorney Duquette that there is another case at Court of Appeals that has similar facts to this case which is in the briefing stage.
Argument by ADA Donohoo.
Court refers to paragraph 6 of Criminal Complaint.
Attorney Duquette argues for continuance or stay pending interlocuatory appeal.
Court denies continuance or a stay pending appeal and supplements the record with reasons for his decision.
Court has to balance victim's rights with defendant's right.
ADA Donohoo makes a record of discussion with analyst Kayla Neumann.
Attorney Duquette is requesting order be signed so he can proceed with appeal.
Response by ADA Donohoo.
Argument by Attorney Duquette.
Response by ADA  Donohoo as to relevance.
Court takes recess to allow both sides to try and agree on an order.

CLERK: BETH FIEGEL
3:41pm Court in session, appearances remain the same.
3:42pm Both parties agree on the order presented.  Court signs.
DA continues to prepare.  Records will be provided to DA by Atty Duquette by the end of business today.  No reference during voir dire.  
Statement by Atty Duquette requesting to withdraw as attorney.  Court denies motion.
3:44pm Court adjourned.

3:46pm Court goes back on the record.  Appearances remain the same, defendant IS NOT PRESENT.
Stipulation made regarding exhibits being requested to be admitted into the record.  Discharge summary marked and received as exhibit 1.  Progress notes marked and received as exhibit 2.
3:48pm Court adjourned.

2:09 pm  Case called.  Defendant Aaron M Gillett in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court has reviewed doctor's report as well as discharge summaries. 
Attorney Duquette has requested additional records from Aurora but turn-around time for records is 7-10 business days.
Attorney Duquette draws Court's attention to specific portions of report.
Argument by Attorney Duquette.
Argument by ADA Donohoo.
Further argument by Attorney Duquette.
Response by ADA Donohoo who requests Court grant her motion and deny any testimony related to PTSD and anxiety episodes.
Court cites caselaw.
Court finds offer of proof by defense does not support evidence.
New issue raised with regard to anticipated testimony that would come out if defendant chose to testify.
Court questions defendant.
Court has reviewed caselaw pertaining to issues raised.
Request for adjournment of trial was made by email from defense without written motion or affidavit.
Evidence failed NGI portion and also failed to show due care.
Court finds evidence is not relevant, not probative and unfairly prejudicial to State.  Court grants State's motion and denies Defense request for adjournment.
Case confirmed for trial on Monday.
ADA Donohoo will draft order and submit proposed jury instructions on Monday.
Attorney Duquette is not prepared to withdraw NGI plea at this time.  Trial will be bifurcated.
ADA Donohoo requests Court prohibit any testimony in Phase 1 that will be presented as evidence in Phase 2.
State has less than ten witnesses and defense has no additional witnesses other than defendant.
Doctor to be reserved for day four.
ADA Donohoo prefers jury not be allowed to ask questions.
Attorney Duquette would like jury to be allowed to ask questions.
Court will reserve ruling on jury questions.
Both sides admonished about not making any gestures or verbal expressions which could influence jury.
Discovery is complete.  Attorney Duquette will review State's file today and advise Court immediately if there are any new reports.
Court cites further caselaw he considered. 
3:02 pm  Court in recess.
Minutes filed.

BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY PARENTS - BOBBY AND DEANNA GILLETT.
NOT TO POSSESS ANY INTOXICANTS.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.
